instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.USBC_TB_CC2: What is USBC_TB_CC2? USBC_TB_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power.

It only puls 5V from USBC.

UB400 had <SIGNAL>USBC_TB_CC2</SIGNAL> shorted (0.008 on diode reading), and I've replaced UB400.

Now, <SIGNAL>USBC_TB_CC2</SIGNAL> has 0.606 on diode reading, but it still only puls 5V from USB C.

All CC1/2 has normal diode reading.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> seams to be shorted (0.002 on diode reading)

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Check in ohm scale if any big coil has the same reading as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Don't forget L9080/580.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

No big coil has the same ohm value (0.2 ohm), as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Then is safe to use voltage injection method, to find the culprit.
As always, start with 1V; more than enough for 0.2 ohm resistance to ground.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
